repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body: `vim.lsp.completion` has all the necessary information to include the completion context when sending the request to language servers.

comment_data.body: I'd nest the `context` within a `opts` to account for future extensions like in https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/30936

```suggestion
local function request(clients, bufnr, win, ctx, callback)
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -424,16 +427,19 @@ end
 --- @param clients table<integer, vim.lsp.Client> # keys != client_id
 --- @param bufnr integer
 --- @param win integer
+--- @param context? lsp.CompletionContext
 --- @param callback fun(responses: table<integer, { err: lsp.ResponseError, result: vim.lsp.CompletionResult }>)
 --- @return function # Cancellation function
-local function request(clients, bufnr, win, callback)
+local function request(clients, bufnr, win, context, callback)

comment_data.body: Hmm good point. For consistency with other LSP APIs I'll also change this in the public type.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -424,16 +427,19 @@ end
 --- @param clients table<integer, vim.lsp.Client> # keys != client_id
 --- @param bufnr integer
 --- @param win integer
+--- @param context? lsp.CompletionContext
 --- @param callback fun(responses: table<integer, { err: lsp.ResponseError, result: vim.lsp.CompletionResult }>)
 --- @return function # Cancellation function
-local function request(clients, bufnr, win, callback)
+local function request(clients, bufnr, win, context, callback)

comment_data.body:
This is kind of an awkward name and we don't really want to bikeshed it (though, I know, we don't worry about type names in general), but inlining it seems to make sense for now.

```suggestion
--- @class vim.lsp.completion.trigger.Opts
--- @inlinedoc
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -47,6 +47,9 @@ local ns_to_ms = 0.000001
 --- @field triggers table<string, vim.lsp.Client[]>
 --- @field convert? fun(item: lsp.CompletionItem): table
 
+--- @class vim.lsp.completion.trigger.Opts

comment_data.body: Ehhh I don't have strong feelings about this one. Although I don't have anything concrete in mind I can imagine these options being modified in the future when we add inline completion support, so I prefer the separate definition.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -47,6 +47,9 @@ local ns_to_ms = 0.000001
 --- @field triggers table<string, vim.lsp.Client[]>
 --- @field convert? fun(item: lsp.CompletionItem): table
 
+--- @class vim.lsp.completion.trigger.Opts

comment_data.body: `@inlinedoc` only affects docs, or maybe I misunderstood you? The class definition can remain as-is. Just adding `@inlinedoc` here will avoid some indirection in the docs
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -47,6 +47,9 @@ local ns_to_ms = 0.000001
 --- @field triggers table<string, vim.lsp.Client[]>
 --- @field convert? fun(item: lsp.CompletionItem): table
 
+--- @class vim.lsp.completion.trigger.Opts

@@ -47,6 +47,9 @@ local ns_to_ms = 0.000001
 --- @field triggers table<string, vim.lsp.Client[]>
 --- @field convert? fun(item: lsp.CompletionItem): table
 
+--- @class vim.lsp.completion.trigger.Opts

comment_regular_data.body: Being ambitious and putting this in the 0.11 milestone 🙃

title: feat(lsp): add support for completion context
